bibl.title: Frank Krebs and Pat Daughtery v. King County. Commitment of Pat Daugherty
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory if Washington, County of king, ss. In Justice's Court, Seattle Precinct, King County, W. T., before John F. Miller, J.P.

Territory of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. Patrick Doherty Defendant, To Charles Robinson Constable John H. McGraw Sheriff King Co. and the keeper of the jail of said King County Whereas, at a Justice's Court held at my office, in said county for the trial of Patrick Doherty for the offense herinafter stated, the said Patrick Doherty was convicted of having, on the 7th day of October 1889, in said county, committed the offense misdemeanor of assault and upon conviction, the said Court did adjudge and determine that said Patrick Doherty should pay a fine of 10.00 Ten ddollars, and 22.95 dollars costs, and stand committed daysor until the same be paid: and, whereas, the said Patrick Doherty has made the default in the payment of the same. Therefore, you, the said, Constable are hereby commanded to receive the said Patrick Doherty into your custody in said jail, and him there keep at hard labor for the space of 16 days, unless said fine and costs be sooner paid, or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law. Dated this 10th day of October 1889 John F. Miller Justice of the Peace.
Copy Commitment. Territory of Washington vs. Patrick Doherty 16 da. 1889 Seattle Printing & Stationery Co., 211 Seneca St.
